newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on Monday on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.

"The interbank rate eased slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were steady to easier but bond prices were slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.85/2.80 percent compared with last Friday's yield of 2.93/2.88 percent but one-year was unchanged from last Friday's yield of 2.80/2.75 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 ended at S$98.38/98.43 against last Friday's close of S$98.30/98.35, May 2002 at S$99.38/99.43 versus S$99.33/99.38 and June 2003 at S$94.38/94.43 from S$94.33/94.38.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 2-3/8 2-1/4 percent against last Friday's 3 2-7/8 percent.
